curam.util.client.domain.marshal
Class SimpleXPathADCMarshal

java.lang.Object
  curam.util.common.plugin.AbstractPlugIn
      curam.util.common.domain.AbstractDomainPlugIn
          curam.util.client.domain.marshal.AbstractDomainMarshal
              curam.util.client.domain.marshal.SimpleXPathMarshal
                  curam.util.client.domain.marshal.SimpleXPathADCMarshal
All Implemented Interfaces:
DomainMarshal, DomainPlugIn, PlugIn
public class SimpleXPathADCMarshal
extends SimpleXPathMarshal

A marshal for string values that represent XML documents. This extends the SimpleXPathMarshal class to perform automatic data conversion (ADC) using the appropriate domain converter plug-ins, where the XML elements have an attribute to identify the domain of the value in the body text of the element. The same XPath location paths supported by the super-class are supported by this class.

Automatic Data Conversion

This marshal plug-in will perform automatic data conversion (ADC) on the values in the XML content. This requires that the XML content store values in a particular form: the value must be the body content of an element and the element must have an attribute identifying the name of the domain definition to apply to the value. The values must use the "generic" string form of the data, to be compatible with the parseGeneric method of the domain converter plug-in associated with the domain. ADC cannot be applied to the values of attributes or the results of XPath function calls, only to the body text of elements; however, attributes can still be used for values if ADC is not required.

Without ADC, the formatted values and raw values that are returned by the getter methods are both the literal string values that are retrieved from the XML document. With ADC, the formatted values are the values formatted according the the locale of the active user and the raw values are the Java object representations of those values appropriate for the indicated domain. 

 <values id="a1" locale="en">
   <value domain="SVR_INT32">1234</value>
   <value domain="SVR_DATE">20080131</value>
   <value domain="ADDRESS_DATA">
     <addr>Apt. 86</addr>
     <addr>1000 Main St.</addr>
     <city>Newtown</city>
   </value>
 </values>

For example, with reference to the above sample XML document, if the path /values/value[1] is passed to the SimpleXPathMarshal.get(Object, Path) method, then the result will be the string string "1,234" if the user's locale is, say, "en", where a comma is used as a thousands separator. Similarly, if the path is /values/value[2], then the result will be "31-Jan-2008" if the user's locale is "en" and if that particular date format is set. For raw values, the effect is similar, but the corresponding Java object will be returned instead of a formatted string. For example, it will be a java.lang.Integer for the "SVR_INT32" domain, or a curam.util.type.Date for the "SVR_DATE" domain. Date and date-time values should be in the UTC time zone, they will be converted to the user's time zone when formatted.

The name of the attribute that is used to retrieve the domain name can be configured; by default, the attribute name "domain" will be assumed. If the selected element has no such attribute, then ADC will not be performed for the value and the literal string value will be returned as both the formatted and raw value of that element. This is simply the default behavior inherited from the super-class.

The following configuration properties control the ADC functionality:

  • adc-domain-attribute - Set to the name of the attribute to look for when getting the value of an element. If the element has an attribute with this name, then its value is assumed to be the domain name and the converter plug-in for that domain will be applied to the value. The default name is "domain".

Reusing this Marshal

See the super-class for more information on reusing this marshal plug-in class.

Method Detail

convertData

protected java.lang.Object convertData(Path path,
                                       java.lang.Object context,
                                       java.lang.Object nodeOrValue,
                                       boolean format)
                                throws MarshalException

Converts the string value of a node or atomic value to a raw or formatted value. This operates in the same manner as the method inherited from the super-class except for element nodes.

If the node is an element node and there is an attribute on the element identifying the domain name for the value, then the value is automatically converted using the appropriate converter plug-in for that domain. The conversion assumes that the value uses the "generic" string representation of a value for that domain. If the format parameter is false, then the value is parsed to its "raw" Java object form and returned. If the format parameter is true, then the raw value is obtained and formatted to a string according to the active user's locale by the converter plug-in's format method.

If the node is an element and there is no attribute identifying the domain name, then the element's value is returned without any conversion.

Overrides:
convertData in class SimpleXPathMarshal
Parameters:
path - The Path used to select the node.
context - The context object.
nodeOrValue - The node or atomic value to convert.
format - true to format the result to a localized string representation, false to return the raw value.
Returns:
The raw or formatted value.
Throws:
MarshalException - If the conversion fails.
